title: [Large-Scale] ISO 10015-Based Social Education Training Design and Development Strategy for Enhancing Civic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic instructional design theories and digital learning tools, understanding of social learning environments and civic engagement activities
context.additional_context: Emphasizing Practical Competencies Applicable to Real Educational Development Projects. Optimizing Content for Mobile Device Use in a BYOD Environment. Designing Collaborative Learning Activities for Solving Local Community Issues and Emphasizing Cross-Cultural Understanding

learning_goals: Procedures for applying the ISO 10015 framework for educational needs analysis can be explained in the context of solving local community issues.
When designing virtual training programs, strategies linking educational objectives to assessment tools can be established in terms of developing civic rights and responsibility competencies.
Methods for developing content that enhances learner engagement in mobile microlearning environments are applied to promote local community collaboration.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
